content.title: BRING YOUR OWN DEVICE (BYOD) POLICY
sections: 1. SCOPE: This policy governs use of personal devices (smartphones, tablets, laptops) to access Company systems and data.
2. APPROVAL: You must register your device with IT before accessing Company data. Email [IT_EMAIL] with device details (make, model, OS version).

3. ELIGIBLE DEVICES:

**Permitted:**
- Smartphones (iOS [MIN_IOS_VERSION]+, Android [MIN_ANDROID_VERSION]+)
- Tablets (iOS [MIN_IOS_VERSION]+, Android [MIN_ANDROID_VERSION]+)
- [Laptops (Windows [MIN_WINDOWS_VERSION]+, macOS [MIN_MACOS_VERSION]+)]

**Not permitted:**
- Jailbroken/rooted devices
- Unsupported operating systems
- Devices without encryption

4. SECURITY REQUIREMENTS:

Your device must have:

✓ Strong passcode/biometric lock (minimum [6] digits, complex password preferred)
✓ Auto-lock after [2] minutes inactivity
✓ Full device encryption enabled
✓ Up-to-date operating system (automatic updates enabled)
✓ Anti-virus/anti-malware (on laptops)
✓ Mobile Device Management (MDM) app installed ([MDM_APP])
✓ Two-factor authentication for Company accounts
✓ Firewall enabled (laptops)
✓ Bluetooth disabled when not in use

5. PERMITTED USE:

You may access:
- Company email
- [Company apps/systems listed in approval email]
- Cloud storage ([CLOUD_SERVICE])
- Video conferencing ([VIDEO_APP])

You may not:
- Store Company data locally on device (cloud only)
- Install unapproved apps that access Company data
- Access Company systems on public Wi-Fi without VPN
- Sync Company data with personal cloud services (e.g., personal iCloud, Google Drive)

6. DATA PROTECTION:

- Company data must be stored in Company-approved cloud storage only
- Use separate work and personal email accounts
- Do not forward Company emails to personal accounts
- Do not copy Company data to personal apps
- Enable 'Find My Device' for remote wipe capability
- Encrypt sensitive data
- Comply with UK GDPR and Data Protection Policy

7. MOBILE DEVICE MANAGEMENT (MDM):

We use MDM software ([MDM_APP]) to:
- Enforce security policies
- Remotely wipe Company data if device lost/stolen
- Monitor compliance (device status only, not personal data)
- Push security updates

**MDM can:**
- See device status (OS version, encryption, passcode enabled)
- Enforce security settings
- Remotely wipe Company data (containerized approach - personal data not affected)

**MDM cannot:**
- See personal messages, photos, or browsing history
- Track location (unless location services enabled and you consent)
- Access personal apps or data

8. LOST OR STOLEN DEVICES:

**IMMEDIATELY:**
- Report to IT: [IT_PHONE] / [IT_EMAIL]
- We will remotely wipe Company data
- Report to police (get crime reference number)
- Report to mobile provider to block SIM

**You are responsible for:**
- Reporting promptly (within [4] hours)
- Any breach resulting from delay

9. PRIVACY:

**What we access:**
- Work-related data only (emails, documents in work container)
- Device security status

**What we don't access:**
- Personal messages, photos, contacts, apps
- Browsing history
- Location (unless you consent for specific apps)

We respect your privacy in accordance with GDPR and Human Rights Act (Article 8 - right to privacy).

10. ACCEPTABLE USE:

- Use device responsibly
- No illegal activity
- No downloading pirated content
- No visiting malicious websites
- No excessive personal use during work hours
- Comply with Acceptable Use Policy

11. OWNERSHIP:

- You own the device
- Company owns all Company data on device
- You are responsible for device costs (purchase, repairs, insurance, data plan)

12. REIMBURSEMENT:

[OPTION 1: No reimbursement for BYOD.]
[OPTION 2: Allowance of £[AMOUNT] per month towards costs.]
[OPTION 3: Reimbursement of business calls and data usage (submit receipts).]

13. LEAVING THE COMPANY:

- Company data will be remotely wiped from your device
- Uninstall MDM app (instructions provided)
- Delete Company accounts and apps
- Return any Company equipment (e.g., laptop docking station)

14. PROHIBITED ACTIVITIES:

- Jailbreaking/rooting device
- Disabling security features
- Sharing device passcode
- Allowing others to use your device to access Company data
- Connecting to unsecured Wi-Fi without VPN
- Storing unencrypted Company data locally

15. SUPPORT:

**IT supports:**
- Setup and configuration of work apps
- MDM installation
- Remote wipe if lost/stolen

**IT does not support:**
- Personal device repairs
- Personal app issues
- Non-work-related problems

16. CONSENT AND AGREEMENT:

By using your personal device for work, you agree to:
- Comply with this policy
- MDM installation and monitoring
- Remote wipe of Company data if necessary
- Security requirements

You may withdraw consent and stop using BYOD at any time (Company will provide corporate device if role requires).

17. CONSEQUENCES:

Non-compliance may result in:
- Revocation of BYOD access
- Disciplinary action (if data breach or serious violation)
- Liability for losses resulting from your breach
content.gdpr_considerations:
BYOD raises GDPR issues:
- Employer must not access personal data on employee's device
- Containerization/MDM to separate work and personal data
- Privacy impact assessment for MDM
- Employee consent to monitoring (freely given)
- Right to privacy (Article 8 ECHR)
- Data security measures (Article 32 GDPR)
